sentences.english: Willing is not enough , we must do.
sentences.chinese: 光是希望是不夠的，非去做不可。

sentences.english: The piling up of sheer historical fact about the Galilean, however, is not sufficient.
sentences.chinese: 光是把有關耶穌的史料堆積起來是不夠的。

sentences.english: The light perceived by the human eye is measured in units called lumen-hours.
sentences.chinese: 人類眼睛所觀測到的光是以流明小時這種單位度量的。

sentences.english: Mere cleverness without sound principles does not count for anything.
sentences.chinese: 光是聰明而無正確的原則是毫無價值的。

sentences.english: To be sure, elections alone are no guarantee of anything.
sentences.chinese: 可以肯定的是，光是選舉什麼也保障不了。

sentences.english: It disgusts me to think that there are still survivors.
sentences.chinese: 光是有生還者這件事就讓人厭惡。

sentences.english: That was the true Light, which lighteth every man that cometh into the world.
sentences.chinese: 那光是真光，照亮一切生在世上的人。

sentences.english: Awareness alone an important figure in the head on the exchange, incomprehensible.
sentences.chinese: 光是認識重要人物，就寒暄得頭昏腦脹，不知所云。

sentences.english: One involved light, which was thought to be a smoothly oscillating electromagnetic wave.
sentences.chinese: 其中一個涉及到光，人們認爲光是平穩振盪的電磁波。

sentences.english: Veiling glare is one of the important factors causing deterioration of image quality in optical systems.
sentences.chinese: 雜光是影響光學系統像質的重要因素之一。

sentences.english: Only see an old father-in-law, Qin Dynasty enough have a headache of.
sentences.chinese: 光是見老丈人，秦朝就夠頭疼的了。

sentences.english: Shulga says that in the last five days alone she was asked to take care of five children from such backgrounds.
sentences.chinese: 沙佳說光是這五天，她就照顧五位這樣背景的孩子。

sentences.english: Whether your light is bright, dull, or completely out, you are loved.
sentences.chinese: 不管你的光是亮，暗，還是完全熄滅，神都愛你。

sentences.english: Simply to imagine a pig flying is ridiculous .
sentences.chinese: 光是想象一隻豬在飛就覺得荒謬可笑。

sentences.english: More than 70,000 students were scheduled to take the exam in Beijing alone.
sentences.chinese: 光是在北京，就有7萬考生計劃參加考試。

definition: at the minimum/at the very least
enough (sufficient)/enough (too much)/(coll.) (before adj.) really/(coll.) to reach by stretching out
needless to say/it goes without saying
sufficient to.../so much so that/so that
let alone/to say nothing of/besides/what's more
to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
it is obvious that.../as one can well imagine...
over ten thousand/fig. untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands
